syllabus:
English III is one of the three-semester English language courses required at NTNU. This course on **Humanities and Cultures Exploration** focuses on introducing students to humanity topics like languages, cultures, literature, history and geography. The three components are briefly described below.

1.  **Language, Culture and Literature (8 weeks)**

Topics on world languages and the status of English will be introduced to help students know how languages are used in the world. Then the interaction among language, culture and literature will be discussed through reading and video-watching. Students are expected to engage in critical reading and discussions based on the materials provided in class.

1.  **Geography (4 weeks)**

The purpose of the 4 weeks of geography course is to familiarize students with a geographical perspective of living in the university. The lecturing will introduce geographical terms so that the students may gain spatial perspectives of experiencing their environment. By conducting field trips around university campuses and the Hsin-Dian River which links two NTNU campuses, the students will be immersed in environmental milieu for achieving lively individual experience in the environment.

**3\. History (4 weeks)**

Through thematic design, this part of the course enables students to further understand the overview of the field of history, and learn to abstract, discuss, criticize and analyze academic cases. The history component of the course will improve students' reading, oral communication, writing and listening skills in the field of history.

**Tentative Weekly schedule**

Week 1- Week 4: Language, Culture and Literature

Week 1: Course Introduction

Week 2: Languages around the world

Week 3: The Status of English/World Englishes

Week 4: Language and Culture

Week 5- Week 8: Geography

Week 5: Environment of a University Town: Fundamental human geography and physical geography of a university town

Week 6: Student Life on Campus and its Surroundings: Urban history and how urban history becomes geography

Week 7: Exploring NTU System Universities: the geography of University development

Week 8: Biking as a Way of Exploring City and its Ecology: a city by the river

Week 9- Week 12: History

Week 9: History of Christianity-1

Week 10: History of Christianity-2

Week 11: History of French Revolution-1

Week 12: History of French Revolution-2

Week 13- Week 16: Language, Culture and Literature

Week 13: Non-verbal Communications

Week 14: Cultural Differences and Cross-cultural Communication

Week 15: Literature and Culture

Week 16: Final Presentation of the Project

**Grading Policy**

1.  Attendance: 20%
2.  Assignments: 40% (to be assigned by teachers of each component)
3.  Final Project: 40%

For the final project, students will choose one of the three options. The written report of the project is due on December 1. Outstanding projects in each option will be chosen for presentation on December 22 (Week 16). Bonus points will be awarded to those projects presented on the last day of class.
